meanings.def: to stand in a line or row; to form a queue
examples: Cars lined up waiting to board the ship.

meanings.def: to arrange people or things in a straight line or row
examples: The suspects were lined up against the wall.
He lined the bottles up along the shelf.

meanings.def: to arrange for an event or activity to happen, or arrange for somebody to be available to do something
examples: Mark had a job lined up when he left college.
I've got a lot lined up this week (= I'm very busy).
She's lined up a live band for the party.

meanings.def: to move one thing into a correct position in relation to another thing
examples: To get good TV reception, the dish must be accurately lined up with the satellite.

meanings.def: the people who are going to take part in a particular event
examples: Jones has not been included in the quarter-final line-up.
the starting line-up (= the players who will begin the game)
The team returns this season with a new car and a new line-up of drivers.

meanings.def: a set of items, events etc. arranged to follow one another
examples: A horror movie completes this evening's TV line-up.

meanings.def: a row of people, including one person who is suspected of a crime, who are shown to a witness to see if they can recognize the suspect
examples: He was identified in an April 21 police line-up.
